entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, popularity of politicians, evaluation of the work of the government and opposition, subjective financial situation, evaluating the economic situation of Hungary 2) opinions about Hungary joining the European Union, the economic effect of EU accession to Hungary 3) xenophobia, opinions about refugees 4) social identity, migration, national consciousness, relationship to ethnic minorities, attitudes towards immigrants, ISSP 2003 national identity Hungarian data, consciousness of being Hungarian, national identity, nationalism, etnnocentrism 5) car demand and supply, attitude surveys regarding driving a car 6) internet penetration, prevalence of internet use, internet providers, knowledge about the reduced price internet access introduced by the government
entry.dcterms:subject: consumption/consumer behavior
information society
income, property and savings
social behaviour and attitudes
mass media
international politics and organisations
religion and values
economic conditions and indicators
political ideology
cultural and national identity
political institutions, public administration
person
survey data
time-series

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: A, block 4: B, block 5: D
